title: David Milne (rugby league)
text:
David Milne is an Australian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 2000s and 2010s. Milne last played for the <a href="Mackay%20Cutters">Mackay Cutters</a> which is a feeder team for the <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland Cowboys</a>. His usual position was as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Fullback">Fullback</a>.
Playing career.
Milne debuted for the <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a> in 2005, winning the club's rookie of the year award. After a period moving between the NRL and <a href="NSW%20Premier%20League">Premier League</a> Milne returned to the Raiders side in round 9 of <a href="Nrl%202007">2007</a>, securing a regular first grade position at wing. Early 2008 a season-ending injury to <a href="William%20Zillman">William Zillman</a> gave Milne the opportunity to start at fullback after <a href="Bronx%20Goodwin">Bronx Goodwin</a> failed to hold his position as the fill in Fullback for Zillman.
After limited opportunities in Canberra and being the 3rd choice fullback behind <a href="Josh%20Dugan">Josh Dugan</a> and Nathan Massey, Milne signed with the <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland Cowboys</a> in October 2011 and played for their feeder team the <a href="Mackay%20Cutters">Mackay Cutters</a> in 2012.
